The issue is with the type of the canvas element being passed to the WebGLRenderer constructor. In your current code: ```javascript //Renderer const canvas = document.querySelector('.webgl'); const renderer = new THREE.WebGLRenderer({ canvas: canvas }); ``` The problem is that `document.querySelector('.webgl')` is returning `null` because there's no element with the class `.webgl` in your HTML file. Looking at your HTML: ```html

Soon will be three.js

``` You need to either: 1. Add a canvas element with the class "webgl" to your HTML: ```html

Soon will be three.js

``` Or: 2. Create the canvas element dynamically in your JavaScript: ```javascript //Renderer const renderer = new THREE.WebGLRenderer(); document.body.appendChild(renderer.domElement); renderer.setSize(sizes.width, sizes.height); ``` The second approach creates the canvas element automatically and appends it to the document body. Looking at your HTML: ````html path=Chapter-01/lesson-3/first-three.js-project/index.html mode=EXCERPT

Soon will be three.js

```` You need to either: 1. Add a canvas element with the class "webgl" to your HTML: ````html path=Chapter-01/lesson-3/first-three.js-project/index.html mode=EDIT

Soon will be three.js

```` Or: 2. The error message: > "Argument type { canvas: Element } is not assignable to parameter type WebGLRenderer~Options Type Element is not assignable to type DOMElement" This error occurs because: 1. **Type mismatch**: `document.querySelector('.webgl')` returns an `Element | null`, but Three.js expects a more specific `HTMLCanvasElement` type for the canvas option. 2. **Missing canvas element**: Looking at your HTML file, I notice there's no canvas element with the class "webgl".
